185940015.review:
Homefront is a unique and compelling first-person shooter that offers players an intense alternate history experience with a surprisingly well-crafted narrative. The game's strongest attribute is its powerful storytelling, presenting a dark and immersive vision of a North Korean invasion of the United States that feels both provocative and emotionally engaging. While the single-player campaign is notably short—around three hours—it packs an incredible amount of cinematic storytelling and atmospheric world-building into its brief runtime, with each level feeling like a meticulously crafted painting that captures the brutal reality of occupation.

The gameplay, though familiar, provides solid shooting mechanics and an interesting variety of weapons that become progressively more interesting as players advance through the campaign. Multiplayer stands out as particularly enjoyable, with a team-based scoring system that emphasizes collective performance over individual kill counts, creating a more collaborative and strategic online experience. The game's maps are well-designed, conveying a compelling sense of a crumbling, occupied America that feels both authentic and emotionally charged.

Despite some technical limitations and graphical shortcomings, Homefront manages to create a uniquely immersive shooter experience that goes beyond traditional military game narratives. Its willingness to explore darker themes of war and occupation, combined with its innovative storytelling approach, makes it a memorable—if flawed—entry in the first-person shooter genre.

I would cautiously recommend this game for a quick campaign fix for $5 or less, just know what you are getting (4 hrs of play) and make sure it runs on your pc within the 2 wk return period. I finished the story mode in about 3.6 hrs and I probably won't play it again. Gunplay is pretty fun, and the TTK is fast which makes it a little more immersive. On the other hand, you have some really dumb video game logic.

1. character tells you that you can fire when ready, but you actually can't fire until an icon changes or you fail the mission

2. There are 62 collectibles and they are all text which I guess they expect you to read mid combat? Also, if you go looking for them the AI characters will nag you endlessly to get into position so they can continue

3. You can't stop a convoy of three fuel trucks with the chopper you are in which fires rockets and high caliber bullets, you must unload your squad mates onto the trucks Fast & Furious style so they can hijack them. Hijacking was not the plan, they literally imply you are unable to stop them with the chopper.
 
4. If you do something even a split second too soon before you are told to do it you will fail the mission, even though your have a squad mate that starts firefights twice when he loses his temper. These fights were unplanned in the mission and would have gotten you killed irl. He is the most vocal character trying to make sure you do exactly as he says. Hypocrite!!!

5. The low TTK combined with your squad mates mostly letting you do the work can make it feel like  you are playing COD TDM with a team of .1 k/d players.

I did have some fun with the game though, like I said the gunplay is fun. The AI characters exclaim when you are kicking ass with lots of headshots and stuff. Lots of guns that you can pick up off of enemies that all feel different and fun to use. Decent vehicle sections gameplay wise. 

For me, the game runs fine, great even. I average probably 400 fps unlocked. Some of these people with crashing problems should post their PC specs--exact parts and what OS they are on. Maybe the game doesn't like certain pc parts, who knows

Personally I'm using:
WIndows 11 (fully updated)
Intel 12700k
Nvidia 4080 Super
M.2 SSD

I didn't have to jump through any hoops to run the game. I just installed it fresh from Steam, and it ran. The only thing I can think of that's non-standard is that I have removed Game Bar completely from my system as soon as I installed WIndows 11. Maybe there is compatibility issues with that.

184031455.review:
Histoire :
Homefront propose un récit sombre et captivant situé dans un futur proche où une Corée du Nord unifiée a envahi et occupé les États-Unis. Vous incarnez Robert Jacobs, un ancien pilote recruté par la résistance américaine pour combattre l’occupant. L’histoire se distingue par son ton mature et ses moments poignants, mettant en avant les horreurs de l’occupation et les sacrifices de la lutte pour la liberté. Bien que relativement courte, la campagne laisse une impression durable grâce à ses scènes mémorables et son atmosphère oppressante.

Gameplay :
Le gameplay est un FPS classique mais efficace, combinant des séquences intenses de combats de guérilla et des phases plus scénarisées. Les missions varient entre infiltrations discrètes et batailles ouvertes, avec des moments marquants comme la conduite d’un drone télécommandé ou l’assaut sur des forteresses ennemies. L’action est fluide, et l’arsenal d’armes modernes est bien équilibré, même si certaines mécaniques peuvent paraître linéaires. Le rythme soutenu de la campagne compense ce manque de liberté.

Graphismes :
Pour son époque, Homefront propose des graphismes solides. Les environnements, qui vont des banlieues américaines dévastées aux camps de travail oppressants, sont bien réalisés et immersifs. Les effets de lumière et les détails environnementaux contribuent à renforcer le sentiment de désolation. Cependant, certaines textures et animations, notamment pour les personnages secondaires, sont légèrement datées.

Difficulté :
Le jeu offre une difficulté modérée, adaptée à la plupart des joueurs. Les ennemis, bien qu’un peu prévisibles, compensent par leur nombre et leur placement stratégique, obligeant le joueur à adopter des tactiques réfléchies. Les checkpoints bien répartis permettent une progression fluide sans frustration excessive.

Durée de vie :
La campagne principale dure environ 4 à 6 heures, ce qui peut sembler court, mais le rythme effréné et l’intensité des événements rendent l’expérience satisfaisante. Le mode multijoueur, bien que plus limité aujourd’hui, était un ajout apprécié à l’époque de la sortie, offrant des combats stratégiques avec des véhicules et des drones pour prolonger la durée de vie.

Prix (en solde) :
En solde, Homefront est souvent disponible pour moins de 5 euros, ce qui en fait un achat intéressant pour les fans de FPS narratifs. À ce prix, l’expérience vaut largement son coût, même pour une seule partie de la campagne.

Conclusion :
Homefront brille par son récit poignant et son atmosphère immersive, offrant une perspective unique sur une guerre fictive mais crédible. Bien qu’il n’apporte pas de révolutions dans le genre FPS, il délivre une expérience courte mais intense, portée par une histoire captivante et des moments d’action mémorables. À petit prix, c’est un jeu qui mérite d’être essayé par les amateurs de récits militaires alternatifs et de combats nerveux.
